author: Назар Богудан
title: Joshua Gets World Title Fight Hopes Because of Usyk
text:
Getty Images/Global Images Ukraine. Anthony Joshua
The World Boxing Organization (WBO) has officially ordered Ukrainian boxer Oleksandr Usyk to defend his title against Joseph Parker.
WBO President Gustavo Oliveri gave Usyk 30 days to negotiate a fight with Parker.
The situation is closely monitored by former world champion Anthony Joshua. AJ and his team hope that Usyk will take the fight with Parker. In this case, Joshua plans to hold his next fight against Daniel Dubois for the IBF heavyweight title.
Last year, Joshua was sensationally outclassed by Dubois, losing by brutal knockout in the fifth round.

author: Get News
title: Choicese (CHC-SES) aims to provide users with convenient, secure, and innovative financial services. | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
The international investment platform Choicese (CHC-SES) has announced it would cooperate with a local Fintech Brand to jointly expand their business operations and drive the development of innovative fintech solutions in the Indian market. This partnership brings new opportunities and growth prospects for the fintech industry in India, aiming to provide users with convenient, secure, and innovative financial services.
This collaboration brings several benefits to This Fintech Brand. Firstly, through the partnership with Choicese (CHC-SES), it gains access to broader international market channels and investment resources, which will accelerate its expansion and innovation in the Indian fintech sector. Choicese (CHC-SES), as a globally influential investment platform with extensive expertise, will provide strategic guidance and global connections to the brand, facilitating the promotion of its products and services.
Secondly, this collaboration enables This Fintech Brand to leverage Choicese (CHC-SES)'s expertise and best practices in the fintech industry. Choicese (CHC-SES) has accumulated rich experience in investing in and driving it, which will offer valuable guidance and insights to the brand. The partnership fosters knowledge sharing and technological exchange, leading to the development and implementation of innovative solutions.
Furthermore, this collaboration will further propel the growth of the Indian fintech industry. The combined strength of This Fintech Brand and Choicese (CHC-SES) will bring more convenient, secure, and innovative financial services to Indian users. With the power of fintech, users will benefit from efficient payment and transfer services, intelligent investment tools, and personalized financial planning advice. This will enhance financial inclusion in India and drive sustainable economic growth.
In conclusion, the collaboration brings new opportunities and growth prospects for the Indian fintech industry. This partnership strengthens their capabilities and influence, driving the development of innovative fintech solutions and providing users with convenient, secure, and innovative financial services, ultimately contributing to the prosperity and sustainable development of the Indian economy.
Disclaimer: The information provided in this press release is not a solicitation for investment, or intended as investment advice, financial advice, or trading advice. It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency.

author: Social Links for Andrew Battifarano View Author Archive
title: Tom Brady 'very mad' about losing beach football game at white party
text:
Sports Entertainment Tom Brady ‘very mad’ about losing beach football game before Michael Rubin’s white party By Social Links for Andrew Battifarano View Author Archive Follow on X Get author RSS feed Thanks for contacting us. We've received your submission.
Back to Reading Published July 25, 2024, 8:12 p.m. ET Tom Brady might be retired from playing NFL football, but that does not mean his competitive juices have completely evaporated.
Brady, the seven-time Super Bowl champion, lost a July 4 beach football game in the Hamptons before Fanatics founder and CEO Michael Rubin’s famous white party .
Rubin told Bleacher Report’s Taylor Rooks that Brady was “very mad” that he lost the game.
“He was mad, very mad,” Rubin said about Brady’s mindset after the loss. “I was also mad too ’cause I thought we were going to win.”
Michael Rubin tells @TaylorRooks details on the beach football game with Tom Brady, Micah Parsons, C.J. Stroud and more before his White Party
(via Taylor Rooks X) pic.twitter.com/UhWXT97ceA
— Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) July 25, 2024
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Michael Rubin (@michaelrubin)
Explore More Tom Brady linked to SI Swimsuit model Brooks Nader in latest dating rumor Tom Brady ‘ignored’ Terrell Owens’ plea for Bucs comeback attempt after Antonio Brown walkout Jalen Brunson inspired by Derek Jeter, Tom Brady, Patrick Mahomes in new deal Rubin, the sports merch company exec, opened up on some details about the game, saying he was Brady’s first pick.
“And you were the franchise pick,” Rooks said.
“Which was the mistake,” Rubin said in a self-deprecating reply. “That’s like when you draft somebody wrong. Tom drafting me with the first pick was a gigantic error.”
In the game, a 5-4 loss for Brady’s crew, which included Odell Beckham Jr. and Micah Parsons, the former Patriots and Buccaneers signal-caller threw an interception that went back the other way to Bills defensive back Damar Hamlin.
3 Tom Brady playing football on the beach in the Hamptons. Instagram 3 Damar Hamlin intercepted a Tom Brady pass. Instagram 3 Tom Brady and Michael Rubin attend the REFORM Alliance Casino Night Event at Ocean Casino Resort on September 30, 2023 in Atlantic City, New Jersey. Getty Images for REFORM Alliance The other team, which also included Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud, appeared to be ready for the moment to take down a football giant.
“What I didn’t realize for C.J. and Damar was they’re like ‘We’re playing f–king Tom Brady,'” Rubin recalled. “‘You guys are having fun, we’re coming to kill.’ … I mean Tom always wants to win in everything he does. The other team was like ‘This is our chance to actually beat Tom Brady.'”
Brady will now be taking his talents to the broadcast booth, calling games for Fox as the No. 1 NFL team’s analyst .

author: Metro Transfer News Reporter
title: Thierry Henry hails Arsenal transfer target Dominic Solanke
text:
Thierry Henry has hailed Arsenal transfer target Dominic Solanke amid his glowing form for AFC Bournemouth this season in the Premier League.
Arsenal news, exclusives and analysis
Privacy Policy https://policies.google.com/privacyand Terms of Serviceapply.
Mikel Arteta
will reportedly push for Arsenal to sign Solanke in the January transfer window if they miss out on Ivan Toney.
The 26-year-old former Chelsea and Liverpool star has registered 12 goals across 18 top-flight matches this term – with only Erling Haaland having scored more.
With
Arsenal set to miss out on a deal for Brentford’s Toney, they could now look to snatch Solanke from the Cherries if they are willing to do business.
Following Arsenal’s 2-0 defeat to West Ham on Thursday night,
in which Henry called out struggling forward Gabriel Jesus, the Arsenal legend spoke in glowing terms about Solanke, who has been capped once by England.
Asked to name a player who has impressed him in the Premier League this season, Henry told Amazon Prime: ‘Dominic Solanke, the way he is playing at Bournemouth.
‘Not only him, the team is doing extremely well, but we have been waiting for him to be that player.
‘It guess it was a bit too much when he was younger. But what he is doing right now is brilliant.
I am happy for him because he did struggle for a little bit. Now he is looking good.’
Solanke only signed a new deal with Bournemouth in September, committing himself to the south coast club until 2027.

author: Dede Henley
title: The Secret to Feeling Less Lonely in Only 8 Minutes - Thrive Global
text: The US has seen a sharp uptick in loneliness in recent years, so much so that last May, Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy [declared loneliness and social isolation a national healthcare crisis](https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2023/05/03/new-surgeon-general-advisory-raises-alarm-about-devastating-impact-epidemic-loneliness-isolation-united-states.html), on par with smoking, heart disease and cancer. Even before the pandemic, approximately 50% of the adults in the US were experiencing [measurable levels of loneliness](https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2023/05/03/new-surgeon-general-advisory-raises-alarm-about-devastating-impact-epidemic-loneliness-isolation-united-states.html.) and isolation. “How’s THAT even possible?” a friend asked me as we chatted about this recently. She went on to say how she felt more connected to her friends and family than ever before. She told me that social media has allowed her to reconnect with old schoolmates she’d long forgotten existed. She knows who’s divorced or lost their hair, how many kids they have or if they own a labradoodle. She knows their political leanings and who has a good sense of humor. She regularly envies the ones who have stayed fit, own a beachfront vacation home or travel the world. She feels sad and writes her condolences with all their other friends when someone has lost a parent or a child or a job. “I am very connected to my community,” she assured me. Is she, though? This conversation reminded me of a crucial distinction Brene Brown once made. What my friend is describing is communication, not connection. Social media platforms are communication platforms. They are not connecting platforms. Brown stressed how important it is to remember this. Relationships are the only anecdote to combat loneliness, chronic instability and the uncertainty — even anxiety — many of us experience. Dr. Murthy points out a number of societal changes that have led to increased loneliness. Community activities like supper clubs, roller rinks, bowling alleys and church gatherings have declined, reducing chances for social interaction. We are more mobile. People often move away from their hometowns, away from family and old friends. More people are living alone, especially as our population ages. Technology makes it easier to connect but often replaces in-person contact with less meaningful interactions. Even the increase in self-service kiosks and checkouts at stores cuts down on small talk with strangers, [which can help with feeling connected](https://time.com/6280607/small-talk-tips-benefits/). The shift to remote work and Zoom calls means we might be seeing our colleagues less, leading to fewer opportunities for socializing. All of this adds up to a nation of isolated and lonely people. In a [podcast](https://simonsinek.com/stories/the-incredible-power-of-an-eight-minute-catch-up-with-a-friend/) conversation between Simon Sinek and Charlene Tosi, Sinek mentioned [research](https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/02/well/phone-call-happiness-challenge.html) that found when someone is struggling or in need, all they need is eight minutes from a friend to hold space with them to make them feel better. That’s it: just eight minutes — the time it takes to cook spaghetti al-dente! Sinek said a good friend of his now uses the codeword “8 minutes” when she really needs to talk to him. And he knows to listen. What might your life or work look like if you asked for eight minutes (or paused to give it) to truly connect in a meaningful way? Might it help shift us out of the downward spiral of loneliness and isolation in our country?

author: Brittany Kriegstein
title: October was the driest month ever recorded in NYC. Don't expect much rain soon.
text: October was the driest month in New York City since record-keeping began more than 100 years ago, according to meteorologists. And the dry spell is not forecast to end anytime soon. “It's almost 'rinse and repeat' except we're not getting rinsed off,” meteorologist Dominic Ramunni of the National Weather Service said. “We're going to see another few days of very unseasonably warm weather as we move into early next week.” Central Park has seen just barely 1.5 inches of rain since the beginning of September – a number that normally hovers around 7 or 8 inches, Ramunni said. And October was the driest part of that period, with just .01 of an inch of rain recorded in the park. But the month had one more record left to break before turning the calendar page: It was the warmest Halloween ever, according to meteorologists. Even though Friday morning might see a sprinkle or two come through, the National Weather Service has issued a [red flag warning](https://www.weather.gov/lot/firewx_definition#:~:text=A%20Fire%20Weather%20Watch%20or,watches%20and%20red%20flag%20warnings.) for New York, New Jersey and Connecticut for the day – due in part to blustery winds, which increase the risk that fires can start and be carried around. That means residents should use closed containers to burn anything, extinguish outdoor fires with plenty of water, and never leave fires unattended. The weather service also warns people not to throw cigarette butts or matches out of moving cars, because they can ignite on dry roadside grasses. The current warning will last until Friday evening, when winds are expected to die down, however the weather service has been issuing such warnings frequently. Temperatures will be cooler over the weekend, with a crisp 58 degrees forecasted as a high for the New York City marathon. A frontal passage next week could bring a few rain showers, but Ramunni said they won’t be enough to meaningfully change the dry conditions – which have[ stuck around so long](https://gothamist.com/news/central-parks-dry-spell-nears-century-old-record-as-october-remains-rain-free) thanks to a high-pressure system and a pattern of moisture-lacking air that’s prevented rainfall. “The drought buster is just not on the horizon at this point,” he said. While New York hasn’t seen many major fires yet, New Jersey and Connecticut have [battled hundreds of blazes](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/31/nyregion/new-jersey-connecticut-wildfires-drought.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share) that have consumed hundreds of acres this fall – sharp increases from 2023. Despite the lack of rain, New York’s reservoir levels are still [not far below normal](https://www.nyc.gov/site/dep/water/reservoir-levels.page). Parts of coastal and southwest New Jersey are in [more dire water conditions](https://dep.nj.gov/drought/current-conditions/). Most of Connecticut’s reservoirs have also [not yet entered](https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/departments-and-agencies/dph/dph/drinking_water/pdf/surface-water-capacity-summary-and-drought-tracking-report-10-25-2024.pdf) drought stages.
